title: Generating the (define (...)) statement (HtDF)
question:
When the purpose is to select an image from a subset of other images, I'm having some trouble defining the function itself. In class, when we did the example of the rotating image we ended up with:
define (topple img)
    (rotate 90 img))
So this makes sense to me because the end result of the image becomes rotated by 90 degrees and through the check-expect, when we input (rectangle 10 20 "solid" "blue"), the expected result is a 90 degree rotated rectangle. With that said, when selecting an image, I'm not too sure how to approach defining the function. I initially assumed an if statement or a (<...) type of function would work but both these produce boolean values rather than images. So I was just wondering how I would approach defining the process of taking two images, and selecting a particular image for a particular trait?
(Hopefully this question doesn't have any academic misconduct issues)
